name: Tumble
description: A creature can try to tumble through a hostile creature's space by making a Dexterity (Acrobatics) check contested by the hostile creature's Dexterity (Acrobatics) check. The tumbling creature can use its action or bonus action to attempt the tumble.

mechanics.onSuccess: The tumbling creature can move through the hostile creature's space once this turn
mechanics.onFailure: The tumbling creature's movement is stopped. It cannot move through the hostile creature's space.
mechanics.movement: Moving through the hostile creature's space still costs movement as normal. The hostile creature's space is not difficult terrain for this movement.
limitations: The creature can only move through the hostile creature's space once per tumble attempt
The hostile creature does not move; only the tumbling creature passes through
This does not provoke opportunity attacks by itself (though leaving the hostile creature's reach afterward might)
A creature cannot end its turn in another creature's space

interactions: Dexterity-based characters (Rogues, Monks, Rangers) excel at tumbling due to high Acrobatics modifiers
Rogues with Expertise in Acrobatics are particularly effective at tumbling through enemy spaces
This provides a Dexterity-based alternative to Overrun (which uses Strength), giving agile characters their own method of moving past enemies
Using a Bonus Action for tumble preserves the creature's Action for attacking or other abilities
Unlike Overrun, Tumble does not have size-based Advantage/Disadvantage, making it equally effective regardless of relative creature sizes
This synergizes with Cunning Action (Rogue) since Rogues already have valuable Bonus Action options and may prefer using their Action to tumble while using Cunning Action for other purposes
